intro: Botrychium obliquum var. rutaceum, commonly known as the yellow moonwort, is a fern-like plant belonging to the family Ophioglossaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a fleshy, club-shaped sporangium at the base of the frond. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and have a distinct, often yellowish or greenish hue. Botrychium obliquum var. rutaceum plays a role in forest ecosystems by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for microorganisms.
